revised_title: Experimental Confirmation of Suprarenal Capsules Function in Fishes
tldr: The author investigates the function of suprarenal capsules in various fish species and discovers that the medulla of the suprarenal capsules, not the interrenal body, is responsible for producing a rise in blood pressure when extracts are injected into the circulation of a living animal. This research provides experimental evidence supporting the idea that the paired segmental bodies correspond to the medulla of the suprarenals in higher vertebrates, while the interrenal body corresponds to the cortex.
